title: Beastie Boys - So What Cha Want

facts.text: The iconic "shhh" hand gesture? Inspired by a Spike Jonze prank on the Boys during video rehearsals!
Song recorded in 1992 at G-Son Studios with Mario Caldato Jr., who mixed it on a rare SSL 4000 console.
Mike D wrote the opening line after a fan yelled it at him during a NYC street argument.
MCA (Adam Yauch) battled cancer later but co-directed this video under pseudonym 'Nathanial Hörnblowér'.
'Check it out' hook samples a 1970s funk record, flipped into hip-hop gold by the Dust Brothers.
Video directed by Spike Jonze, who later helmed Jackass and Oscar-winning 'Here We Go Round the Mulberry Bush'.
Peaked at #93 on Billboard Hot 100 but #3 on Modern Rock Tracks—radio loved it more than charts!
Ad-Rock's backwards pants in the video? A thrift store find that became 90s grunge fashion inspo.
Released amid 1992 LA riots; lyrics' raw energy captured the era's urban tension perfectly.
Beastie Boys donated video shoot profits to Hollywood NAACP after Rodney King verdict fallout.
Mix Master Mike wasn't in the band yet—this track features their original DJ Hurricane on cuts.
Video's dog-pee-on-MCA scene improvised when a stray pup wandered onto the junkyard set!
From platinum album 'Check Your Head,' blending punk, hip-hop, and funk—sold 3M+ copies.
Diamond Dallas Page wrestling move 'People's Elbow'? He credits Beastie Boys' wild energy for it.
Early 90s alt explosion: Nirvana, Pearl Jam peers; Beasties bridged rap-rock gap wide open.
MCA rapped the bridge while battling tinnitus from years of deafening live shows.
VH1's Pop Up Video ranked this #1 Beasties vid for its chaotic, junkyard slam-dance vibe.
Sampled in Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas—millions blasted 'So What'cha Want' on virtual radios.
